alert.note: Alert for Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 1:40PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Graham and north central Cochise Counties through 215 PM MST... At 139 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Willcox, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Willcox. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 336 and 360. Route 186 between mile markers 327 and 340. Route 191 between mile markers 88 and 101. Route 266 near mile marker 108. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox
